document.masterDocTitle: On some Maerid genera (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Maeridae) collected by the Hourglass Cruises (Florida). Part 1: Genera Anamaera, Ceradocus, Clessidra gen. nov., Jerbarnia, Maera, Meximaera, with a key to world Ceradocus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On some Maerid genera (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Maeridae) collected by the Hourglass Cruises (Florida). Part 1: Genera Anamaera, Ceradocus, Clessidra gen. nov., Jerbarnia, Maera, Meximaera, with a key to world Ceradocus

caption.paragraph:
Figure 6.
Ceradocus cf. shoemakeri
female 4.5 mm, FSBC I 45185. Gn1, gnathopod 1; Gn2, gnathopod 2; P3,4, peraeopod 3,4; Ep1–3, epimeral plates 1–3; T, telson.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The unspecialized second gnathopods and short telsonic setae could also fit the females of
C. paucidentatus
(a species from California ), but Ep2 should be smooth there. Also
C. breweri
is strikingly similar, especially based on the incomplete original description of a single female of 8 mm . In the description by Krapp-Schickel (2008a) of
C. breweri
from Florida the telsonic robust setae are different being clearly inserted on the inner side of the telsonic lobes and in a well-defined excavation, while both
C. shoemakeri
and the here discussed material have a much longer robust seta inserted on the outer margin of the telsonic lobes.

In
C. shoemakeri
the adult males have serrations also on Ep1, but these could develop with age; also the relative length of telsonic setation is reported as different with age (in younger specimens the robust setae are relatively longer). For the moment it seems quite probable that the above cited material belongs to this species.
